fields.physical_description:
This is a rather crudely made toy; hand carved and painted but not smoothed down. It is the stylized form of the horse and carriage mounted on a flat base which in turn is on four wheels held to a static axle by wooden pegs. The horse is painted when with blue; orange; green and black decoration representing flowers and bunches of straw for the mane and tail. The carriage and shafts are painted orange with blue; dark red; yellow; green; white and black floral decorations. The base is painted yellow with orange; white; green and black decorations. The ends of the axles are yellow and the wheels painted orange with black markings; the pegs are also orange. The horse and carriage are
nailed to the base; the shafts are nailed to the horse at one end and the carriage at the other. 
This toy was made to traditional designs and it would have been
sold to the Co-operative group for sale. Although the area co-operatives have been replaced there is still no credit given to an actual maker.
fields.title: HORSE AND CARRIAGE
fields.history_note:
References: RUSSIAN FOLK TOYS booklet published by the Museum of Toys; USSR Academy of Pedagogical Sciences. see also registered packet

Collection was presented to BGM by the Traditional Sergiev Cultures Centre; following an exhibition at the Cambridge Folk Museum; September 1994. The items are modern; made to the traditional designs and methods by craftsmen whose families had produced the toys before 1900.

Price: £12.00
fields.production_note:
Made by: made in the village of Gorodetch; in the region of Nizhni Novgorod; no known maker
Russia
